result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Timothy Alloway was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Timothy Alloway was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Timothy Alloway was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Timothy Alloway was found guilty of Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber allowed.

Community service authorized under 973.03(3)
The defendant must install IID on all vehicles titled in his name and upon issuance of a valid drivers license.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA meeting per week.

The defendant may not consume or possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Alloway

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation - Granted
IID waiver for motor cycle-faxed to DOT this date-cg
1 certified driving record 2 pictures of weapon

Defendant Timothy Alloway in court with attorney Jeffery Arthur Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:43 pm resolved. State -  Acknowledge 3 priors and plead to count 1 ( state offers certified driving record) 170 days jail, $2605 fine, $35 blood draw fee to city of Crandon, 30 mo DL suspension, count 2 amend to 1st offense possession THC $500 plus costs, count 3 co ordinance possess paraphanelia, count 4 plead costs only, count 5 DRI. Court DRI count 5, court amends count 3 to possession of co ordinance - pleads NC, finds G $1000 plus costs apply bond 60 DTP/CO, count 1 pleads G, count 2 court amends, deleting allegation to 2nd offense misdemeanor, pleads G, count 4 pleads G. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds the defendant is entering his plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering his plea and waiving his right to JT, factual basis, accepts pleas and finds guility of count 1 & 2 and count 4. State/Joy make final arguments follow joint recommendation. State makes statement as to mandatory report on 3rd and subsequent offense. Joy asks for couple weeks to report to jail. Court responds to mandatory reporting to jail. State gives court the picture of the concealed weapon after no objection by Joy. Alloway withholds statement. State discussions now on amendment to count 1 -  I/S 170 days jail stayed and 18 month probation period, 60 days jail and fine $1959 fine, 26 month DL suspension with standard conditions while on probation. Joy not a breach of plea agreement. Alloway agrees with the change. Court proceed to sentencing. Court receives both exhibits (5:11 pm offered by state) Count 1 - I/S 170 days jail, huber and community service authorized under 973.03(3) stayed and place on probation for 18 months with following conditions: 60 days jail (with huber, report 9/12/14 @ 8:30 am)  fine $1959, $35 blood draw fee to city of Crandon, 26 mo DL suspension, IID on all vehicles and upon issuance of valid license 26 months, AODA and follow thru, DA surcharge, employment with verbage (3 wkly), no consume/possess or entry, attend 1 AA meeting per week, 50 hrs co service. Count 2 - fine of $500 plus costs 60 DPT/CO. Count 4 - costs only. Appeal rights given.
No consumption of alcohol, continue with treatment and AA.
Final pre-trial on August 27, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

Called at 10:24 AM. Timothy Alloway appears in person and with counsel Jeff Joy. State appears by JBC. Joy has Information, waives reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT on 8/27/14 at 4:00 PM. Joy makes statement regarding defendant - in treatment at this time and working, argues for reduction in bond for stated reasons ($2000.00 cash). State - bond - no objections. Court modifies bond to $2000.00 cash with same conditions.

Called at 3:42 PM. Timothy Alloway appears in person and with counsel Jeff Joy. State appears by Charles Simono. State - files exhibit #1 - JOC from FC Case #02CM95. State calls Officer DJ Wilson. Wilson sworn in at 3:43 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Joy at 3:50 PM. Wilson excused at 3:54 PM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Joy has Information, would like an ARGN date. Court continues bond, set for ARGN on 7/16/14 at 9:30 AM.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 10:54 AM. Timothy Alloway appears in person and his counsel Jeff Joy appers telephonically with leave of the court. State appears by Jodie Bednar. Joy has amended criminal complaint, waives reading, waives time limits for PH and requests PH. Alloway agrees. Court continues bond, considers time limtis waived, set for PH on 7/9/14 at 3:00 PM.
